channel.title: Whos smart enough to help me
channel.description:
ok the problem is i deleted java out the program files, and emptyed my recycle bin. i know you shouldnt do this but it pissed me off so much at the time i just fucked it off. so anyway.
now it wont let me reinstall haha, karma? im running windows 7 laptops quite new and basicly i cant get jdk or jre.
what ive done so far is deleted it out of windows registry files, and deleted it from remove programs in control panel. but still it dont work ive look everywhere, ive typed java in so many different search boxes that the letter's "J A V" A arent labeled

item.title: Whos smart enough to help me
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:3, topic:366474”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=461598.msg3385225#msg3385225 date=1288396509]
Can’t you umm just reinstall java…I mean it wasn’t there to start with.
[/quote]

Yes, you should re-install

But, He did have it. If you read properly, you would know that he deleted the Java Folder from C:, Which doesnt remove the settings he has

Re-install bro ;D[/quote]
Either way you reinstall the fucking thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Whos smart enough to help me

item.title: Whos smart enough to help me
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Try a ‘repair’ install of windows, but do research on your recovery discs, as some “repair” as in wiping out drives and starting from new, the repair i mean, is re-doing windows files and such. A bit extreme, but it would work

Read full topic
item.source: Whos smart enough to help me

item.title: Whos smart enough to help me
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Well, you could try uninstalling your old settings and re-installing it.
